title: Work & Professions
description: Discuss jobs, workplace environments, business vocabulary, and career-related conversations in Bulgarian.
content:
# Work & Professions

## Grammar Explanation

### Professions

**Common Jobs**:
- Учител/Учителка (uchitel/uchitelka) - teacher (m/f)
- Лекар/Лекарка (lekar/lekarka) - doctor (m/f)
- Инженер (inzhener) - engineer
- Програмист (programist) - programmer
- Адвокат (advokat) - lawyer
- Счетоводител (schetovoditel) - accountant

**Workplace Vocabulary**:
- Офис (ofis) - office
- Фирма (firma) - company
- Мениджър (menidzhăr) - manager
- Колега (kolega) - colleague
- Проект (proekt) - project
- Среща (sreshta) - meeting
- Срок (srok) - deadline

### Work-Related Phrases

- **Работя като...** (Rabotya kato...) - I work as...
- **Работя в...** (Rabotya v...) - I work in/at...
- **Отговарям за...** (Otgovaryam za...) - I'm responsible for...
- **Имам среща** (Imam sreshta) - I have a meeting

### Business Terms

- Заплата (zaplata) - salary
- Договор (dogovor) - contract
- Отпуск (otpusk) - vacation/leave
- Командировка (komandirovka) - business trip
- Кариера (kariera) - career

## Cultural Notes

1. **Work Schedule**: Standard 40-hour work week, Monday-Friday.

2. **Annual Leave**: Minimum 20 days paid vacation per year by law.

3. **IT Sector**: Bulgaria has a growing IT industry, especially in Sofia.

4. **Formality**: Business culture is moderately formal; first names used after initial meetings.
